News.title: LUPIN POSITIVE FACTS DURING A COVID-19 PANDEMIC
News.description: Lupin has received an Establishment Inspection Report (EIR) from the USFDA for its manufacturing plant in Nagpur, Aurangabad and Mandideep with no action indicated.  Lupin has launched generic Mycophenolic acid delayed-release tablets of 180 mg and 360 mg. It is used to prevent organ rejection in patients receiving kidney transplants in the US market.

News.title: FMCG LEADER “HUL” INITIATIVES AGAINST CORONA VIRUS
News.description: HUL has committed Rs 100 crore to help in the fight against coronavirus. The company will also donate 2 crores pieces of Lifebuoy soaps and donate Rs 10 crore to upgrade the health care facilities in testing centers and hospitals. Hindustan Unilever has collaborated with UNICEF for a mass communication campaign to inform the public against the COVID-19 pandemic.

News.title: NATIONWIDE LOCK DOWN AFFECTS ON INVESTOR
News.description: Health insurance players will also get a new growth cover as individuals gradually shift health insurance to essential spending. The investor preferences are changing towards sectors like chemicals and pharmaceuticals. Demand cooldown for cooling appliances makers due to lockdown.  The lockdown impact will change investor behaviour towards fresh home purchases hitting the residential segment for some time.

News.title: BRITANNIA INDUSTRIES POSITIVE FACTS
News.description: Britannia Industries could report double-digit growth in consolidated profit in the March quarter due to the lower tax rate. The company declared an interim dividend of Rs 35 per share for the FY-20. The dividend will be paid to the shareholders before May 23, 2020. Britannia has partnered with Dunzo for the home delivery of all its products.

News.title: A DEAL BETWEEN BHARAT EARTH MOVERS LIMITED AND COAL INDIA LIMITED
News.description: Coal India signed two purchase pacts totaling nearly Rs 400 crore with state-owned heavy earthmoving machinery manufacturer BEML for buying seven 150-tonne dumpers and eight 190-tonne dumpers. Coal India plans to invest  Rs 7000 crore in acquiring 360-odd heavy mining machinery over the next three-four years to enhance production for achieving a billion tonnes production capacity by 2024.

News.title: RELIANCE RIGHTS ISSUE UPDATE
News.description: Reliance Industries is considering issuing of shares to existing shareholders on a rights basis to reduce its massive debt pile. The proposed rights issue is the first from the company in 29 years.  Reliance Industries will announce its financial results for the March quarter on April 30. RIL also added that it will recommend dividend on equity shares.

News.title: WHAT IS A RIGHTS ISSUE?
News.description: A rights issue is a way by which a listed company can raise additional capital. The company gives its existing shareholders the right to subscribe to newly issued shares in proportion to their existing holdings at a discounted price. For example, 1:4 rights issue means an existing investor can buy one extra share for every existing four shares.

News.title: WHAT IS A PREFERENTIAL ISSUE?
News.description: A preferential issue is an issue of shares by listed companies to a select group of investors under Section 81 of the Companies Act, 1956. This is a faster way for a company to raise equity capital. A person holding preferential shares has the right to be paid from company assets before common stockholders if the company goes into bankruptcy.

News.title: WHAT IS A FINANCIAL MARKET?
News.description: Financial markets are made by buying and selling numerous types of financial securities including equities, bonds, currencies, and derivatives. These are markets where businesses grow their cash, companies decrease risks, and investors make more cash.  It serves as an agent between the investors and collectors. Types of Financial Markets are capital, money, derivatives, and the forex market.

News.title: MARUTI SUZUKI ZERO SALES IN APRIL
News.description: The country’s largest carmaker Maruti Suzuki reported zero sales in the domestic market last month with factories shut in action with government orders to prevent the check of the coronavirus pandemic. The carmaker suspended operations from March 22, in line with orders from the government. In FY20, automobile volumes declined and expect a double-digit drop in FY21 sales.
